definition: without concealing anything/to pass away/to die
(negative prefix)/not/no
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
to make a full confession/to plead guilty

sentences.english: Comments, industry leader who also makes no secret of their endeavors.
sentences.chinese: 言谈中，行业领头羊们也毫不讳言各自的努力方向。

sentences.english: Those are blunt, unyielding admonitions that ring in my head every day.
sentences.chinese: 那些直言不讳的忠告每天都在我头脑中响起。

sentences.english: Both boys pleaded guilty to the theft charge and face sentencing at a later date.
sentences.chinese: 这两名男孩对该偷盗指控供认不讳，并将被择日宣判。

sentences.english: She never avoids mentioning her mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不讳言自己的错误。

sentences.english: The Street and media responded well to her bluntness.
sentences.chinese: 业内和媒体对于她的直言不讳反应良好。

sentences.english: The EC is not paid by Pakistan, so I can be outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 由于巴基斯坦不向欧共体交钱，所以我可以直言不讳。

sentences.english: The teacher more than hinted at his flaws.
sentences.chinese: 老师毫不讳言指出了他的毛病。
他是一个直言不讳的人。

sentences.english: Kong diverts the company large amount fund to it the delinquent account to confess fully.
sentences.chinese: 孔某对其挪用公司巨额资金的犯罪事实供认不讳。

sentences.english: She minces no words in stating her opinions.
sentences.chinese: 她表达观点总是直言不讳。

sentences.english: The court heard today that O'Connell had previous convictions for theft.
sentences.chinese: 今天，欧康内尔在法庭上对之前的盗窃事实供认不讳。

sentences.english: China makes no bones about letting people the world over know that it has territorial expansionist ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 中国毫不讳言，让全世界都了解它领土扩张的野心。

sentences.english: Russia's big cities are now unashamedly capitalist.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯的大城市如今毫不讳言资本主义。

sentences.english: He pointed out the shortcomings in our work time and again without mincing words.
sentences.chinese: 他不止一次直言不讳地指出我们工作中的缺点。

sentences.english: In this case, we will be completely blunt.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，我们将直言不讳。

sentences.english: "What were you shooting at, at the bend?" Agustin asked bluntly.
sentences.chinese: “你在拐弯那里打谁呢？”奥古斯丁直言不讳地问。

definition: fault/error
great error/heinous crime
to exaggerate/to boast
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
to flog
to violate a ban
to analyze/to explain
to avoid as taboo
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
covertly/secretly
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
to praise sb in his presence
without eloquence/untalented/I, me (humble)
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
how? (emphatic question)
to die by battle-ax (idiom); to be executed
minister not afraid to give forthright criticism
